column2: ItsAbot makes it easy and fun to build your own digital assistant, and we include everything you need to get started.

column5: Update plugin url to fix the 404 Not Found error (#173)

Update README.md

Add cd instruction, and remove cmd/dbsetup.sh command.
Add debug log when connecting to database (#158)

Add support for private repos (#157)

Enable `abot plugin install` to fetch private repos via git.
Load env vars for all CLI actions (#152)

Add live updates when publishing plugins (#150)

Use websockets to communicate with itsabot.org, updating the user with
progress in publishing plugins and notifying the user of any problems
encountered that would prevent the plugin from being published.
Handle corner case for plugin settings (#148)

Remove Procfile, update dependencies (#146)

* Remove Procfile. Be sure to recreate it if you're deploying to Heroku.
* Remove, update dependencies
Add usage examples and help to plugins (#145)

Add settings API

To make plugin installation easier, environment variables that plugins depend
upon have been moved to a specific Settings API. Instead of using os.Getenv,
plugins must now use p.GetSetting(). Those settings must also be declared in
your plugin.json per the updated spec:
https://github.com/itsabot/abot/wiki/plugin.json-Spec
Remove unused plugins.json keys, update README (#140)

Save and add context to sentences (#139)

Replace pronouns with the appropriate nouns to which they refer.
Add people, times to structured input (#137)
Clean up log statements, handling of errors

Add better rollbacks when plugin install fails (#102)

ErrMessage: fix more spelling errors
Exit installing goroutines on errors and don't block processing of errors from channel
Add helpers for testing plugins, plugin scaffolding (#134)

Fix routing, iteration bugs (#133)

* Fix routing, iteration bugs
* Fix task.Iterate tests

Add task.Iterate for plugins (#125)

The Iterate task enables you to easily iterate over a []string in your plugins'
state machines.
Add plugin install step to travis.yml (#128)
Lower memory use of language vars (#127)
Remove unnecessary logs, activity while testing (#126)
Prevent creation of plugin.go in current dir (#124)

Improve time parsing, fix scheduled events (#122)

* Fix scheduled events, improve time parsing
* Add "me" to nouns for Object recognition

Add ABOT_PATH env variable support (#121)

This change enables you to work on Abot from any directory in your
GOPATH by passing by setting the ABOT_PATH env variable, either in
abot.env (for a single install) or ~/.bashrc (global default).

This means you can now fork Abot and develop it in the appropriate
directory in your filesystem.

Fix psql connection error on plugin init

*Abot env variables will now be loaded before plugin is completely initialized.
*Abot env variables will be loaded just once and not at initialization of every plugin.

Abot issue #112 fix

Merge pull request #103 from egtann/plugin-api

Use new plugin API, fix bugs
Update design and add first-run installer

Use new plugin API, fix bugs

1. [Breaking Changes] Simplified plugin API
	* Removed Run/FollowUp functions
	* Renamed Vocab to Keywords and VocabHandler to KeywordHandler, which
	  better reflects their purposes
	* Triggers are now automatically generated for the plugin based on
	  Keywords
	* Defining additional triggers beyond keywords (i.e. to route to
	  your state machine, but not any keyword handler) is now
	  optional and can be done using plugin.SetTrigger()
	* Every plugin now has a state machine that's managed by Abot
	  automatically
		* You should use p.SM to access a pre-configured state machine,
		  rather than building your own.
	* Moved Memory API from the state machine to plugins to better
	  reflect the relationship between memory and the plugin (memory
	  belongs to plugins -- the state machine has nothing to do with
	  it.)
		* Now use p.GetMemory() and p.SetMemory()
	* Branching conversations are still supported
		* Use p.SetBranches(func(in *dt.Msg) []dt.State) to use
		  branching conversations. Change the returned []dt.State based
		  on flags set in memory or by the *dt.Msg passed in.
2. Fixed a large number of state machine bugs
3. Added support for routing to plugins and keyword handlers based on trained
   Intents

Merge pull request #73 from egtann/master

Fix Heroku deploys

Fix Heroku deploys

Make a number of modifications to support deploying to Heroku and other
platforms. Since platforms like Heroku delete data in the filesystem after their
build step, each plugin's plugin.json file is embedded into the generated
plugins.go on install.

Merge pull request #39 from jaredborner/master

Modify setup scripts to accept database parameters

Modify setup scripts to accept database parameters

allowing an optional argument to specify the database connection
parameters allows different connection methods to be used. additionally,
along with some script refactoring, it allows the database to be setup
separately from the abot server.

to support this, cmd/setup.sh was refactored into the following scripts:
- cmd/setup.sh
- cmd/dbsetup.sh
- cmd/helper_functions.sh

cmd/setup.sh now accepts an optional argument for the database
connection parameters. if no argument is given, it assumes sane
defaults. in both cases, the database parameters are saved in abot.env
under ABOT_DATABASE_URL. during setup, if the psql binary is
unavailable, the script will skip the database setup. it assumes it was
handled externally. otherwise, cmd/dbsetup.sh is called with the same
connection argument (if any) that this script was called with. beyond
that, code was refactored into cmd/dbsetup.sh and
cmd/helper_functions.sh and some general cleanup performed.

cmd/dbsetup.sh contains all the logic for setting up the abot databases.
it also accepts the same optional argument as cmd/setup.sh. this allows
the database to be setup on a different machine than the abot server.
this script now encapsulates the dependency on the psql binary.

cmd/helper_functions.sh contains functions that help with running setup
commands, pretty printing messages, and database parameter parsing. this
allows code re-use between cmd/setup.sh and cmd/dbsetup.sh, which may be
called independently.

the following changes were made to the go code-base:

abot.go:loadEnvVars() is now in core/boot.go:LoadEnvVars(). since the
database connection relies on the ABOT_DATABASE_URL environment
variable, this function needs to be available for plugins/external
packages.

core/boot.go:ConnectDB() now uses the ABOT_DATABASE_URL environment
variable exclusively. if ABOT_DATABASE_URL is empty, it applies
defaults.

shared/plugin/plugin.go:connectDB() is gone. now it uses the code in
core/boot.go:ConnectDB()

Merge pull request #19 from waynegerard/create-error-handling

Return 500s in the event of errors on signup

Return 500s in the event of errors on signup

If the form validation goes through but there's an error at the database
level, or with creating the CSRF token, then return a 500.

We shouldn't allow the user to proceed, but it's not necessarily the
case that they've entered bad data (e.g. pg server being down would also
cause a failure).

Merge pull request #10 from waynegerard/form-validation

Send back 400 errors for form validation errors

Send back 400 errors for form validation errors

Form validation errors should trigger 400s, not 200s. Otherwise,
the user can be taken to e.g. the post-signup page even though their
registration wasn't successful.

Merge pull request #5 from jaredborner/master

Update cmd/setup.sh and env var loading

Update cmd/setup.sh and environment variable loading

modifications to cmd/setup.sh:
- improves the "postgres running" check
- add checks for go binary, psql binary, and GOPATH
- fixes osx/linux compatibility issues with the urandom/tr command
- makes the terminal output prettier
- exports necessary environment variables to a project local "abot.env" file
  this replaces the previous behavior of inserting the variables into the
  users .bashrc/.bash_profile

modifications to abot.go:
- uses values from the new "abot.env" file to update the environment.
  note: it will only update environment variables that are not already set

modifications to .gitignore:
- adds abot.env: it contains the server secret
- adds plugins.go: it is dynamically generated

Add trainer flag to users, enforce client-side

Add a trainer to users, enabling users to be marked as trainers or not. This
restriction is enforced client-side, but not yet server-side.

Add error handling along critical path

Implement better error handling for all endpoints where the user sends Ava a
message and expects a response. Error handling consists of:

	1. Logging the error
	2. Sending an email to the admin containing the error message
	3. Tracking whether an error has already been sent for that request, so
	as to not send separate errors to the admin when they may have
	snowballed, i.e. one error triggered the next
Track new atomic_set and websocket files

Refactor Ava

Add documentation throughout, reorganize the codebase, delete dead code, and
mark incomplete, stubbed code as such.

Add documentation and refactor

Remove useless migrations prior to any open-source release, as well as old and
no longer used files and approaches (e.g. knowledge nodes/edges). Move
migrations to a system based on a UNIX Timestamp, rather than the numbered
approach used previously as this sorts correctly using tools like `ls`.

Timestamps can be generated for new migrations directly in Bash using
`date +%s`.

Add docs, error reporting

Add documentation to functions, begin work needed to email admin error reports,
and refactor the name "conversations" to "messages" where appropriate.
Remove unused prefs, purchases from training page

Update training interface with sockets

This also involved updating dependencies.
Fix signout button, remove unnecessary logs
Integrate GCal into the training interface

Delete generated .js.map file

Signed-off-by: Evan Tann <egtann@gmail.com>

Add inotifywait support for Linux live-reloads

Refactor front-end

Changed mithril.route.mode to "pathname". This avoid the "?" in urls. This
required setting the root echo.Get route from "/" to "/*". Since echo will
match explicit routes first, there is no "route masking" issues

Added live-reload functionality. All this required was a added a simple script
to our index.html template and adding a couple of "cmd" routes to trigger the
reload from the server. Triggering a reload is as simple as calling "curl
localhost:4200/_/cmd/reload".  Along with this is a simple "fswatcher.sh"
script (in the "cmd/" dir) that listens for changes in the assets dir, rebuilds
the public dir from scratch, and calls reload for and open browsers. Note that
the first step in a rebuild is to delete all content from the public dir. This
is done to ensure clean and up to date builds. The script uses the fswatch
application but could be modified to use any other file system watcher. Note:
the live-reload/cmd functionality is only added in development builds

Lastly, the mithril component system has been standardized as follows:
- Each component is in a single file
- Components are wrapped in an IIFE
- Components only have a "controller" and "view function". Nothing else
        Note: some components still have "viewFull" functions that remain to be
        factored out
- Components begin with an uppercase letter

Misc changes:
- routes.js has been moved to app.js
- The google_oauth code is now in app.js
- app.js also contains "helper" functions that are available globally. By
  convention, these will start with a lowercase letter

Signed-off-by: Evan Tann <egtann@gmail.com>

Modify train.js Chatbox components to be stateless

This avoids (not) re-rendering issues

Signed-off-by: Evan Tann <egtann@gmail.com>
Update training interface Chatbox on new trigger

Enable package triggers from training interface

Trainers can now trigger new packages and commands to run via the training
interface. You can see an example inside /assets/js/train.js in
TrainShow.confirmAddCalendar(). These triggers, e.g. "add calendar", are sent to
Ava as if from the user but only Ava's response is saved to the database.

Respond appropriately to niceties and profanity

Ava will refuse to reply to commands with foul language, and she will reply
appropriately (even if that means no reply at all) to niceties like "thanks" and
"cool."

Add branching conversation support

State machines can now exist outside of shared memory with changes persisted to
the database. This allows for branching conversations as seen in
packages/ava_settings/ava_settings.go, where the conversation can change
depending on the states set in the state machine.
Add POS words for future NER
Fix nil access bug during boot
Fix binary conflict on Linux with ava_ prefix
WIP - RPC API and state machine changes
WIP - Compile with state API change

Implements dynamic rpc networking

The existing framework for assigning ports/booting package RPC servers
was too brittle. This implemented a system where all rpc ports are
dynamically assigned by the OS.

Passing ":0" as the addr to a net.Listen() call causes the operating
system to allocate a random, available port. We use this method for all
RPC servers.

First, we boot the core ava RPC server and get the address. Then, we
pass that address to each package as a command line argument. Each
package boots it's own RPC server, and passes the dynamic address to the
core RPC server when it registers itself.

Signed-off-by: Evan Tann <egtann@gmail.com>

Fix dev onboarding errors. Add simple "repl"

There were errors that were preventing development. These errors came
up when there was a missing user, or a package could not be found. This
commit takes care of the errors in the simple case of a developer
starting from scratch.

During user signup, this commit skips the Stripe integration in a
non-production environment. This will allow easier development.

Lastly, it adds a simple http client "REPL" for sending commands to
Ava. It is located in cmd/avarepl/main.go.
